newsitem.title: FRANCE: Kohl drops planned speaking engagement in Paris.
newsitem.headline: Kohl drops planned speaking engagement in Paris.

text.p: German Chancellor Helmut Kohl has dropped plans to travel to Paris on Wednesday to address the parliamentary assembly of the Western European Union, the German embassy said.

The embassy said Kohl was staying in Bonn because Finance Minister Theo Waigel, locked in a battle with the Bundesbank over plans to revalue Germany's gold reserves to improve public finances before joining a single European currency, was to make an important statement in parliament.
The cancellation was not linked to the election of a new Socialist-led government in France, an embassy spokesman said.
Kohl will meet Socialist Prime Minister Lionel Jospin along with conservative President Jacques Chirac at the next regular Franco-German summit rescheduled for June 13 in Poitiers, in western France.
